channel.title: MidwestWeekends - Travel in Minnesota, Wisconsin, Illinois, Iowa
channel.description: Up-to-date information on travel in the Upper Midwest

item.title: Beloved Bayfield
item.description: On Wisconsin's north coast, the love affair between a village and its visitors goes way back.

item.title: Afoot in the Porkies
item.description: On the Upper Peninsula, a splendid wilderness remains unchanged in the Porkies.

item.title: Adventure on the Gunflint Trail
item.description: For outdoorsy folks, this wilderness in northeast Minnesota is a year-round playground.

item.title: White gold in the Porkies
item.description: In Michigan's Upper Peninsula, a wilderness park rewards those who love snow.

item.title: Michigan's great lake cabins
item.description: In the only state that borders three Great Lakes, the best places to stay are in state parks.

item.title: A yen for yurts
item.description: Round canvas huts have come to the Midwest from Mongolia, with love.

item.title: Duluth 101
item.description: Here's everything you need to know about visiting this lively port town on Lake Superior.

item.title: Under one roof in Duluth
item.description: On a cold-weather getaway, friends indulge in antiques, chocolate, craft beer and massages.

item.title: Duluth's grand mansion
item.description: At Glensheen, tourists walk into the life of an extraordinary family.

item.title: Great grape stomps
item.description: At winery harvest festivals, compete with your feet.

item.title: Toasting Oktoberfest
item.description: These festive tributes to Bavarian tradition put the oompah into fall.

item.title: Pizza on the farm
item.description: In Wisconsin and Minnesota, dinner guests flock to the country for ultra-fresh ingredients and idyllic settings.
